Canada dismantles TradeOgre exchange, seizes $40 million in crypto

items.excerpt: Though the groups have shared their decision to go dark, threat researchers say there are signs that it's business as usual.

items.title: Raven Stealer Scavenges Chromium Data Via Telegram
items.excerpt: The new lightweight stealer, distributed via underground forums and cracked software, demonstrates an important evolution in the stealth of commodity infostealing malware.

items.title: North Korean Group Targets South With Military ID Deepfakes
items.excerpt: The North Korea-linked group Kimsuky used ChatGPT to create deepfakes of military ID documents in an attempt to compromise South Korean targets.

items.title: Microsoft Disrupts 'RaccoonO365' Phishing Service
items.excerpt: Phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) kits have become an increasingly popular way for lower-skill individuals who want to get into cybercrime.

items.title: Mastering Digital Breadcrumbs to Stay Ahead of Evolving Threats
items.excerpt: Digital forensics offers a challenging but rewarding career path for cybersecurity professionals willing to invest in specialized knowledge and continuous learning.

items.title: AI-Powered Sign-up Fraud Is Scaling Fast
items.excerpt: The AI era means attackers are smarter, faster, and hitting you where you least expect it — your sign-up funnel.

items.title: 'Vane Viper' Threat Group Tied to PropellerAds, Commercial Entities
items.excerpt: Researchers say the commercial adtech platform and several other companies form the infrastructure of a massive cybercrime operation.

items.title: Self-Replicating Worm Hits 180+ Software Packages
items.excerpt: At least 187 code packages made available through the JavaScript repository NPM have been infected with a self-replicating worm that steals credentials from developers and publishes those secrets on GitHub , experts warn. The malware, which briefly infected multiple code packa…

items.title: Self-Replicating 'Shai-hulud' Worm Targets NPM Packages
items.excerpt: The newly emerged worm has spread across hundreds of open source software packages, stealing credentials and infecting other components without much direct attacker input.

items.title: Ray Security Takes an Active Data Security Approach
items.excerpt: The data security platform comes with a predictive capability that separates it from other offerings aimed at protecting enterprise data, the startup says.

items.title: Innovative FileFix Phishing Attack Proves Plenty Potent
items.excerpt: Highly deceptive FileFix uses code obfuscation and steganography and has been translated into at least 16 languages to power a global campaign.

items.title: Emerging Yurei Ransomware Claims First Victims
items.excerpt: The cybercrime group, named after Japanese ghosts but believed to be from Morocco, uses a modified version of the Prince-Ransomware binary that includes a flaw allowing for partial data recovery. However, an extortion threat remains.

items.title: Critical Bugs in Chaos Mesh Enable Cluster Takeover
items.excerpt: "Chaotic Deputy" is a set of four vulnerabilities in the chaos engineering platform that many organizations use to test the resilience of their Kubernetes environments.

items.title: SecurityScorecard Buys AI Automation Capabilities, Boosts Vendor Risk Management
items.excerpt: The company acquired HyperComply to help enterprises automate vendor security reviews and gain a real-time picture of the security of their entire supply chain.

items.title: 'Lies-in-the-Loop' Attack Defeats AI Coding Agents
items.excerpt: Researchers convince Anthropic's AI-assisted coding tool to engage in dangerous behavior by lying to it, paving the way for a supply chain attack.

items.title: KillSec Ransomware Hits Brazilian Healthcare Software Provider
items.excerpt: The ransomware gang breached a "major element" of the healthcare technology supply chain and stole sensitive patient data, according to researchers.

items.title: 'HybridPetya' Ransomware Bypasses Secure Boot
items.excerpt: The malware, which has traits of Petya ransomware and the infamous NotPetya wiper, is designed to target UEFI-based systems, according to researchers.

items.title: FBI Warns of Threat Actors Hitting Salesforce Customers
items.excerpt: The FBI's IC3 recently warned of two threat actors, UNC6040 and UNC6395, targeting Salesforce customers, separately and in tandem.

items.title: Building Resilient IT Infrastructure From the Start
items.excerpt: CISA's Secure by Design planted a flag. Now, it's on those who care about safeguarding systems to pick up the torch and take action to secure systems throughout the enterprise.

items.title: Without Federal Help, Cyber Defense Is Up to the Rest of Us
items.excerpt: Together, we can foster a culture of collaboration and vigilance, ensuring that we are not just waiting for a hero to save us, but actively working to protect ourselves and our communities.

items.title: Undocumented Radios Found in Solar-Powered Devices
items.excerpt: The US Transportation Department reportedly warns that solar-powered devices used in highway infrastructure have undocumented radios. Is the risk real?

items.title: French Advisory Sheds Light on Apple Spyware Activity
items.excerpt: CERT-FR's advisory follows last month's disclosure of a zero-day flaw Apple said was used in "sophisticated" attacks against targeted individuals.

items.title: Vyro AI Leak Reveals Poor Cyber Hygiene
items.excerpt: The data leak underscores the larger issue of proprietary or sensitive data being shared with GenAI by users who should know better.

items.title: Vidar Infostealer Back With a Vengeance
items.excerpt: The pervasive Vidar infostealer has evolved with a suite of new evasion techniques and covert data exfiltration methods, according to researchers.

items.title: 'K2 Think' AI Model Jailbroken Mere Hours After Release
items.excerpt: Researchers discovered that measures designed to make AI more transparent to users and regulators can also make it easier for bad actors to abuse.

items.title: 'Gentlemen' Ransomware Abuses Vulnerable Driver to Kill Security Gear
items.excerpt: By weaponizing the ThrottleStop.sys driver, attackers are disrupting antivirus and endpoint detection and response (EDR) systems.

items.title: F5 to Acquire CalypsoAI for Advanced AI Security Capabilities
items.excerpt: F5 plans to use CalypsoAI's platform to provide real-time threat defense against attacks and help enterprises safeguard themselves as they adopt the latest AI technologies.

items.title: Cyberattack on Kazakhstan's Largest Oil Company Was 'Simulation'
items.excerpt: Researchers thought a Russian APT used a compromised employee email to attack Kazakhstan's biggest oil company. The company later confirmed it was a pen test.

items.title: Bulletproof Host Stark Industries Evades EU Sanctions
items.excerpt: In May 2025, the European Union levied financial sanctions on the owners of Stark Industries Solutions Ltd. , a bulletproof hosting provider that materialized two weeks before Russia invaded Ukraine and quickly became a top source of Kremlin-linked cyberattacks and disinformat…

items.title: Apple CarPlay RCE Exploit Left Unaddressed in Most Cars
items.excerpt: Even when a vulnerability is serious and a fix is available, actually securing cars is more difficult than one would hope.

items.title: AI-Enhanced Malware Sports Super-Stealthy Tactics
items.excerpt: With legit sounding names, EvilAI's "productivity" apps are reviving classic threats like Trojans while adding new evasion capabilities against modern antivirus defenses.

items.title: The Quiet Revolution in Kubernetes Security
items.excerpt: As Kubernetes becomes the foundation of enterprise infrastructure, the underlying operating system must evolve alongside it.

items.title: Students Pose Inside Threat to Education Sector
items.excerpt: The threats may not be malicious, but they are more than many security teams can handle.

items.title: Dormant macOS Backdoor ChillyHell Resurfaces
items.excerpt: With multiple persistence mechanisms, the modular malware can brute-force passwords, drop payloads, and communicate over different protocols.

items.title: Chinese Hackers Allegedly Pose as US Lawmaker
items.excerpt: Chinese state-backed threat actors are suspected of posing as Michigan congressman John Moolenaar in a series of spear-phishing attacks.

items.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday, September 2025 Edition

items.title: 18 Popular Code Packages Hacked, Rigged to Steal Crypto
items.excerpt: At least 18 popular JavaScript code packages that are collectively downloaded more than two billion times each week were briefly compromised with malicious software today, after a developer involved in maintaining the projects was phished. The attack appears to have been quick…

items.title: GOP Cries Censorship Over Spam Filters That Work

items.title: The Ongoing Fallout from a Breach at AI Chatbot Maker Salesloft
items.excerpt: The recent mass-theft of authentication tokens from Salesloft , whose AI chatbot is used by a broad swath of corporate America to convert customer interaction into Salesforce leads, has left many companies racing to invalidate the stolen credentials before hackers can exploit …
